page.title: 15Changes in Crawford.
page.content: We tried to find out a little of what Crawford was like in the past.We spoke to Mrs Brown,who has lived in Crawford for 80 years and Mrs Devlin ,who has lived here for 75 years.They both went to the village school and it has changed greatly since then. Crawford used to be very popular for holidays.People came by train to golf and fish.The village was very quite then as there were very few cars or lorries. During the Second World War 8000 Polish Soldiers camped at Stoneyburn Farm and the surrounding farms.This made Crawford a very busy place. Both Mrs Devlin and Mrs Brown have seen great changes over the years, although not always for the better.
